contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Coord|24|19|17|N|116|7|10|E|type:landmark|display=title}} {{Chinese |pic=Hzs map020.png |t={{linktext|梅|縣}} |s=梅县 |h=Mòi-yen<br>({{IPA-hak|mɔi˩jɛn˥˧|IPA}}) |p=Méi Xiàn |j=Mui4 Jyun6 }} '''Mei County''' ([[Chinese character|Chinese:]] 梅县 pinyin: Méixiàn) is a [[County (People's Republic of China)|county]] in the municipal region of [[Meizhou]], in northeastern [[Guangdong]] province, the [[People's Republic of China]]. ==Geography== Mei county almost completely surrounds Meizhou's urban district [[Meijiang District]]. This is because the old urban core of Meixian (梅县, "plum county") was separated from the bulk of the county in the territorial reorganisations following the establishment of the [[People's Republic of China]] and given equal status. New executive, legislative and [[Basic people's court|judiciary]] arms had to be established for the county and housed outside the core (in fact upstream from it), as well as [[Communist Party of China|CPC]] and [[Public Security Bureau|PSB]] branch offices. ==Culture== With a majority [[Hakka people|Hakka]] population, Mei County is known as the home of standard [[Hakka language|Hakka]], along with [[Dabu County]]. {{County-level divisions of Guangdong}} [[Category:County-level divisions of Guangdong]] [[Category:Meizhou]] {{Guangdong-geo-stub}}
